User.authentication module

The following class defines a custom token authentication mechanism.

class User.authentication.CustomTokenAuthentication

Bases: BaseAuthentication

Custom token authentication class.

  • Extends BaseAuthentication to implement custom token-based authentication logic.

  • Defines a keyword used for token authentication in the HTTP header.

  • Implements the authenticate() method to authenticate the user based on the provided token.

  • Checks the authorization header for the presence of the custom token keyword.

  • Decodes and retrieves the token from the header, then validates it against stored custom tokens.

  • Retrieves the associated user based on the token’s email.

  • Raises AuthenticationFailed exceptions for various error scenarios, such as invalid token header, missing credentials, invalid token, or invalid user.

  • Implements the authenticate_header() method to specify the authentication header keyword.

authenticate(request)

Method to authenticate the user based on the provided token.

authenticate_header(request)

Method to specify the authentication header keyword.

keyword = 'PatientCustomToken'

User.backends module

User.models module

The following models define the structure for user data and custom tokens used for user authentication.

class User.models.CustomToken(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Model

Custom token model representing tokens used for user authentication.

  • Defines fields for token key, associated user, email, and creation timestamp.

  • Ensures token key uniqueness and sets it as a random hex string if not provided.

  • Sets the associated email from the user object if not provided.

  • Overrides the save() method to handle token key generation and email assignment.

  • Provides verbose names for the model and its plural form for better readability in the admin interface.

user

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

user_id
class User.models.User(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: AbstractUser, PermissionsMixin

Custom user model representing a user of the application.

  • Extends AbstractUser and PermissionsMixin to inherit authentication and permission-related fields and methods.

  • Defines fields for user data such as first name, last name, username, password, birthdate, email, phone, gender, chronic disease, etc.

  • Provides custom validation for the password field using a RegexValidator to enforce specific criteria (minimum length, lowercase, uppercase, digit, special character).

  • Includes choices for the gender field and chronic disease field.

  • Implements a clean() method to perform additional validation, ensuring the password meets the required criteria.

  • Overrides the __str__() method to provide a string representation of the user object (email).

CHRONIC_DISEASE_CHOICES = [('ALS', "ALS (Lou Gehrig's Disease)"), ('Alzheimer', "Alzheimer's Disease and other Dementias")]

In the example:

Place.restaurant is a ReverseOneToOneDescriptor instance.

groups

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

User.serializers module

The following serializers define the structure for data serialization and validation related to the User model and user authentication.

class User.serializers.AuthTokenSerializer(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Serializer

Serializer for user authentication token.

  • Defines the structure for serializing user authentication data.

  • Includes fields for email and password, with password input type set to ‘password’.

class User.serializers.LoginSerializer(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Serializer

Serializer for user login.

  • Defines the structure for serializing user login data.

  • Includes fields for username/email and password.

class User.serializers.PasswordResetRequestSerializer(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for password reset request.

  • Defines the structure for serializing password reset requests.

  • Includes a field for the user’s email.

class Meta

Bases: object

fields = ['email']
model

alias of User

class User.serializers.PasswordUpdateSerializer(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Serializer

Serializer for updating user password.

  • Defines the structure for serializing data required to update user passwords.

  • Includes a field for the new password.

  • Overrides the ‘update’ method to set the new password and save the instance.

update(instance, validated_data)

Updates the user’s password.

class User.serializers.UserSerializer(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for the User model.

  • Defines the structure for serializing User model fields.

  • Specifies the fields to be serialized.

  • Sets ‘write_only’ attribute for the password field to ensure it’s not included in responses.

class Meta

Bases: object

extra_kwargs = {'password': {'write_only': True}}
fields = ['id', 'fname', 'lname', 'username', 'password', 'birthdate', 'email', 'phone', 'gender', 'chronic_disease', 'image']
model

alias of User

User.tests module

User.views module

The following views implement various functionalities related to users in the application.

class User.views.CustomTokenLoginView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

This view handles user login using custom tokens.

  • Handles HTTP POST requests for user login.

  • Validates user credentials (email and password).

  • Generates a custom token for authenticated users.

  • Checks if the user’s email is verified before allowing login.

post(request, format=None)

Handles user login requests. Validates the provided credentials and generates a custom token for authenticated users.

serializer_class

alias of AuthTokenSerializer

class User.views.EmailVerificationView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

This view handles email verification requests.

  • Handles HTTP GET requests to mark the user’s email as verified.

  • Requires the user ID in the URL to identify the user.

  • Sets the ‘is_verified’ flag to True in the User model.

get(request, user_id)

Handles GET requests for email verification. Marks the user with the provided user ID as verified.

class User.views.PasswordResetRequestView(**kwargs)

Bases: GenericAPIView

This view allows users to request a password reset by providing their email address. Upon successful request, a password reset email is sent to the user’s provided email address.

  • Handles HTTP POST requests for password reset requests.

  • Validates the email provided by the user.

  • Sends a password reset email containing a reset link to the user’s email address.

post(request, *args, **kwargs)

Handles password reset requests. Sends a password reset email to the user’s provided email address.

send_password_reset_email(user)

Sends a password reset email to the user’s provided email address.

serializer_class

alias of PasswordResetRequestSerializer

class User.views.PasswordResetView(**kwargs)

Bases: UpdateAPIView

This view allows any user to reset their password.

  • Handles HTTP PUT requests for password reset.

  • Validates the new password provided by the user.

  • Updates the user’s password in the database upon successful validation.

get_object()

Retrieves the user object based on the user_id provided in the URL.

update(request, *args, **kwargs)

Handles password reset requests. Validates the new password and updates the user’s password.

class User.views.UserInfoView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

This view retrieves user information based on the provided user ID.

  • Handles HTTP GET requests to retrieve user information.

  • Requires the user ID in the URL to identify the user.

  • Retrieves user data from the User model and serializes it using the UserSerializer.

get(request, user_id)

Handles GET requests to retrieve user information.

class User.views.UserLogoutView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

This view logs out the user by deleting associated tokens.

  • Handles HTTP POST requests for user logout.

  • Requires user authentication using custom token authentication.

  • Deletes all tokens associated with the authenticated user.

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
post(request, format=None)

Handles user logout requests. Deletes all tokens associated with the authenticated user.

class User.views.UserSignupView(**kwargs)

Bases: CreateAPIView

This view allows users to sign up by providing their details. Upon successful signup, a verification email is sent to the user’s provided email address.

  • Handles HTTP POST requests to create a new user account.

  • Validates user input data using the UserSerializer.

  • Checks for existing usernames and emails to prevent duplicates.

  • Upon successful signup, sends a verification email containing a verification link.

create(request, *args, **kwargs)

Handles user signup requests. Checks for existing username and email. Sends verification email upon successful signup.

queryset = <QuerySet [<User: Ismail.ahmed02@eng-st.cu.edu.eg>, <User: tewom26711@gexige.com>, <User: Elsayedblash@icloud.com>, <User: mohamedkhaledbulkheir@gmail.com>, <User: elshelyziad@gmail.com>, <User: mohamed.ahmedfrg.2002@gmail.com>, <User: fayam12668@artgulin.com>]>
send_custom_email(user_id, email)

Sends a custom verification email to the user’s provided email address.

serializer_class

alias of UserSerializer

class User.views.UserUpdateView(**kwargs)

Bases: UpdateAPIView

This view allows authenticated users to update their profile information.

  • Handles HTTP PUT requests to update user profile information.

  • Requires user authentication using custom token authentication.

  • Retrieves the authenticated user object.

  • Validates and updates user data using the UserSerializer.

authentication_classes = [<class 'User.authentication.CustomTokenAuthentication'>]
get_object()

Retrieves the authenticated user object.

perform_update(serializer)

Saves the updated user data.
